page.title: 04STROUDWATER CANAL CONTINUED.
page.content: Some sections of the canal have been cleared.Both the Trust and Company believe that it will be re-opened one day.There are many problems in restoring the canal e.g. finance,obtaining permission from the owners of adjacent land and rebuilding the locks.All the locks along the canal have to be rebuilt.In this area there are 3 sets of locks - Ryeford Double , Dudbridge and Foundry Locks. When the canal is re-opened it will be used for pleasure boats, angling and nature conservation.The restoration will cost several million pounds.Mr.Nott thought it would possibly take 15 years.The Canal Trust does most of the work with the help of the Manpower Services Commission aided by financial help from the Company.
